com.amadeus

Class Params

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
        • com.amadeus.Params
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>

    public class Params
extends java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
    A convenient helper class for building data to pass into a request. 
       amadeus.get("/foo/bar", Params.with("first_name", "John").and("last_name", "Smith"));
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static Params with(@NonNull
                          @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object value)
        Initializes a new Param map with an initial key/value pair. 
           amadeus.get("/foo/bar", Params.with("first_name", "John"));
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the parameter to send to the API
        value - the value for the given key
        Returns:
        the Param object, allowing for convenient chaining

      • and

        public Params and(@NonNull
                  @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.Object value)
        Adds another key/value pair to the Params map. Automatically converts all values to strings. 
           amadeus.get("/foo/bar", Params.with("first_name", "John").and("last_name", "Smith"));
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the parameter to send to the API
        value - the value for the given key
        Returns:
        the Param object, allowing for convenient chaining

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts params into a HTTP query string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
